intro: Hallia lineata, commonly known as the lineated hallia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features slender, upright stems that are often hairy and bear alternate, lance-shaped leaves with distinct longitudinal veins. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its root system is fibrous and contributes to its adaptability in various soil types. Hallia lineata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
